abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Municipal Management
            Project for Sri Lanka was unsatisfactory. The project failed
            to achieve several of its major objectives, its impact on
            institutional development was partially successful,
            sustainability is unlikely, and both the Bank and Borrower
            performed satisfactorily. Several lessons can be learned
            from this project. First, projects which aim to strengthen
            political institutions and affect the system of governance
            tend to be more vulnerable to changes in government. Second,
            projects with long-term objectives are more susceptible to
            changing macroeconomic and political situations. Third,
            borrowers must be fully aware of the need for institutional
            development and the long-term financial benefits it will
            produce. Fourth, projects experiencing problems require an
            intensive program of missions. Finally, performance
            indicators should be identified in terms of the long-term
            objectives of the project.

docna.cdata!:
Sri Lanka - Municipal Management Project :
            Credit 1697 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Sri Lanka - Municipal Management
            Project : Credit 1697 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Municipal Management Project will
            comprise technical asistance and studies in the areas of
            urban management and policy, financial management, local
            resource mobilization, urban service delivery, mapping and
            human resource development. As well as aerial photography,
            surveys and map production for urban areas will be a
            demonstration municipal civil works. Furthermore, the credit
            will provide funds for supplies, vehicles and equipment
            required for the efficient provision of the technical
            assistance and training.
